1.text: Now concerning things sacrificed to idols: We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up, but love edifieth.

2.text: If any man thinketh that he knoweth anything, he knoweth not yet as he ought to know;

3.text: but if any man loveth God, the same is known of him.

4.text: Concerning therefore the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that no idol is anything in the world, and that there is no God but one.

5.text: For though there be that are called gods, whether in heaven or on earth; as there are gods many, and lords many;

6.text: yet to us there is one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we unto him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and we through him.

7.text: Howbeit in all men there is not that knowledge: but some, being used until now to the idol, eat as of a thing sacrificed to an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

8.text: But meat will not commend us to God: neither, if we eat not, are we the worse; nor, if we eat, are we the better.

9.text: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of yours become a stumblingblock to the weak.

10.text: For if a man see thee which hast knowledge sitting at meat in an idolâ€™s temple, will not his conscience, if he is weak, be emboldened to eat things sacrificed to idols?

11.text: For through thy knowledge he that is weak perisheth, the brother for whose sake Christ died.

12.text: And thus, sinning against the brethren, and wounding their conscience when it is weak, ye sin against Christ.

13.text: Wherefore, if meat maketh my brother to stumble, I will eat no flesh for evermore, that I make not my brother to stumble.
